Posts.Content: Hi Ruby Rose, thanks for responding with your experience - I really appreciate it. Yes, I’ve got a wig already in case I need it and will get my hairdresser to trim it so it’s more like my own hair.  I’m glad to read that you’re hair has grown back and that you’re very happy with it. I’ll just be happy if I can keep enough so that it looks ‘usual’and that I can get away without the wig. I’m also putting on the make-up - even when I go for chemo. It makes me feel better and I’ve also been paying more attention to my skincare. Thank you again Ruby Rose Love, Rambler x
Posts.Title: Hair Shedding Whilst Using Cold Cap

Posts.Content: Hi NiceCuppa, totally agree with you. I washed my hair today and have noticed that I’ve lost some hair at the crown along with at least with major thinning all over. All in just under a week - it’s left me gutted and like you, tipped me over the edge today, but I have a wonderful partner to help me. But its the hair that has sent me low - I can cope with everything else. I just want this shedding to stop! Thanks for taking the time to reply, I really appreciate it and am sending positive thoughts to you
Posts.Title: Hair Shedding Whilst Using Cold Cap

Posts.Content: Hi, I started my first chemo on the 30th Jan and used the cold cap. Hair-wise all was fine until last weekend when I started shedding hair. I had second chemo with cold cap this week and this morning brushed gently to find that I had to clear my brush five times due to the amount of hair loss. I’ve been constantly shedding since last Saturday and it doesn’t seem like it’s going to stop. I’m finding this very hard to cope with as I’ve always had long straight fine hair (I’m 50). I had it cut into a shoulder length bob ahead of the chemo and am only washing it once a week and don’t style it and am following hair care to the book. I’d appreciate it very much to hear anyone else’s experience of hair shedding: when did it stop (if all), how much hair lost etc. I realise that hair shedding/loss can’t be predicted as it’s so dependent on the individual and their treatment, but any advice, personal experience or morale boosting would be so very welcome at this time.
